page.title: 20EDUCATION IN AMBLE
page.content: Since{reorganisation of education}in Northumberland in the{1970s}schooling in{Amble}has been established under the{tripartite system of first, middle {and high schools.}The{Coquet High {School}was{officially opened in 1982 by{Councillor Mrs Ellen Mitchell, {Chairman of the Education Committee. It is a{purpose-built high school}with {excellent facilities}for academic, social, and sporting activities, including a{first class sports hall and running track.{Amble Middle School is housed in the former secondary school building, while the{First {School}is located in a new building. Pupils from the{catchment area are {bussed to the High School,}which has about{700 pupils}on the roll, including a{Sixth Form of about 60 {students.}The school has a{Youth {Association}and an{Adult Association.
